_prev_prog_3.Description: Sunview Dried Fruit and Nut Company has prepared a unified Risk & Process Safety Management Program. The program is in compliance with Californias Accidental Release Prevention (CalARP) Program (in California CCR Title 19, Chapter 4.5 Program Level 3 Elements. At the Federal level, Title 40 CFR Part 68), and California OSHAs Process Safety Management (PSM) of Acutely Hazardous Materials standard (in California CCR Title 8, Section 5189, Process Safety Management of Acutely Hazardous Materials, and Federally Title 29 Code of Federal Regulations (CFR) 1910.119). This program has been prepared to address the risks involved with the presence of sulfur dioxide in an amount in excess of 5,000 lbs., which is used in our dehydration process.

_exec_summary.SummaryText:
1    EXECUTIVE SUMMARY



This program is intended to meet the spirit and intent of the following regulations:



?    California Accidental Release Prevention (CalARP) Program - Title 19 CCR, Chapter 4.5

?    Federal EPA Risk Management Program (RMP) - Title 40 CFR ?68

?    California Process Safety Management (PSM) Program, Title 8 CCR ?5189

?    Federal Process Safety Management (PSM) Program, Title 29 CFR ?1910.119



Hereafter this program will be referred to as the RMP-PSM program.



This program is intended to be a "living document". As such, the information, procedures, policies, and documentation that make up this program must be made easily accessible and updated as necessary. To accomplish this, Sunview Dried Fruit & Nut Company has elected to use PSMWriter, software developed and distributed by Resource Compliance, Inc. This software will assist us with updating, maintaining, scheduling, and tracking RMP-PSM related activities. 



1.1    SUNVIEW DRIED FRUIT & NUT COMPANY, RISK & PROCESS SAFETY MANAGEMENT PROGRAM 



This is to inform all interested persons, including employees, that Sunview Dried Fruit & Nut Company has updated/developed their unified RMP-PSM Program. This program has been prepared to address the risks involved in operating and maintaining the following processes which have the presence of hazardous chemicals above threshold quantities: 



Process Name     Process Chemical    Process Quantity(lbs.)

Sulfur Dioxide    Sulfur Dioxide            12,000



Our RMP-PSM program promotes overall plant, worker, and public safety. The program enables our facility to prevent the occurrence, and minimize the consequences, of significant releases of hazardous chemicals. Overall, the program is designed to prevent accidental fatalities, injuries, and illnesses and avoid physical property damage.

Sunview Dried Fruit & Nut Company has an exemplary safety record, one that we are quite proud of. Our company has many policies and procedures in place to promote overall plant, wo

rker and public safety. We have:

 

1.    Prepared a unified program based on the PSM plan to meet CalARP and RMP obligations as well

2.    Organized the program so that it meshes closely with general Sunview Dried Fruit & Nut Company business practices

3.    Utilized PSMWriter software to ensure that all necessary Sunview Dried Fruit & Nut Company employees have access to relevant information (SOPs, PHAs, audits, etc.)



The RMP-PSM program sets forth rules, procedures and practices that will help our employees protect themselves and our neighbors.



1.2    PROCESS DESCRIPTION



Sunview Dried Fruit and Nut operates a dehydating facility that utilizes sulfur dioxide chambers for color preservation in the fruit drying process.  Sulfur dioxide is piped from a ton-container to each chamber using stainless steel pipe and ball valves. When in use, each chamber receives 40-80 lb of sulfur dioxide gas. 

 

The sulfur dioxide containers at Sunview Dried Fruit and Nut consists of vessels which are co-located such that a release of sulfur dioxide could impact the ability to operate vessels which are not directly connected.  Therefore, we are treating all of the containers as a single process.



1.3    GENERAL ACCIDENT RELEASE & CHEMICAL SPECIFIC PREVENTION STEPS



1.3.1    GENERAL 



We inform our employees engaged in process operations of the dangers of an accidental release of sulfur dioxide in annual safety meetings. During these meeting we also discuss preventative measures, such as evacuation, in order to be prepared for a release.



Sunview Dried Fruit & Nut Company has also conducted an off-site consequence analysis of worst-case and alternative release scenarios for the sulfur dioxide process. These are for the purposes of informing the public in the event of an accidental release. The results of the analyses are reported in the body of the program. 



1.3.2    SULFUR-DIOXIDE



The sulfur-dioxide process at the Sunview Dried Fruit & Nut Company facility is an integral part of

overall business and lasts for approximately five months out of the year. The sulfur-dioxide process contains multiple cylinders with a maximum inventory of 12,000. It is extremely important that these areas and associated injection processes are maintained and operated in a safe and efficient manner. Sunview Dried Fruit & Nut Company is committed to making sure that employees are made aware of the potential danger of exposure to sulfur-dioxide.



Our personnel also monitor the sulfur-dioxide fumigation process and keep an active log of all associated procedures and transactions. In addition, the process is checked frequently during the season by the outside contractor that supplies the SO2 cylinders. The contractor also assists in performing the annual mechanical integrity review of our process equipment. 



1.4    FIVE YEAR ACCIDENT HISTORY



Sunview Dried Fruit & Nut Company has had no accidental release within the last five (5) years.



1.5    EMERGENCY ACTION AND RESPONSE PLAN



Sunview Dried Fruit & Nut Company's emergency action and response program has been developed to satisfy the following requirements:



?    California "Emergency Action Plan" - Title 8 CCR ?3220

?    Federal "Emergency Action Plan" - Title 29 CFR ?1910.38 

?    California "Hazardous Waste Operations and Emergency Response" (HAZWOPER) - Title 8 CCR Title 8 ?5192(q)

?    Federal "Hazardous Waste Operations and Emergency Response" (HAZWOPER) - Title 29 CFR ?1910.120(q)



Strategically, we will respond "minimally" to a release. Under this plan we will call emergency personnel and evacuate the facility. All response activities would be done in coordination with the Local Fire Department and their Hazardous Materials Response Team. 



Every year we review with our employees our evacuation procedures in the event of an emergency, including a hazardous chemical release.



1.6    PLANNED CHANGES TO IMPROVE SAFETY



Our company has an outstanding safety record, one that we are quite proud of. Many polici

es and procedures have been implemented to promote overall plant, worker and public safety. Nevertheless, Sunview Dried Fruit & Nut Company continually strives to improve in all areas, including safety.



By utilizing PSMWriter software, all necessary employees have access to every aspect of the RMP-PSM program. This has improved Sunview Dried Fruit & Nut Company's ability to communicate hazardous situations to employees and contractors. In addition, PSMWriter tracks all RMP-PSM related events so that Sunview Dried Fruit & Nut Company's management team can ensure that the RMP-PSM program is being implemented.



Sunview Dried Fruit & Nut Company has implemented all aspects of the RMP-PSM program. When a RMP-PSM program requirement is completed (i.e. mechanical integrity inspection, process hazard analysis, compliance audit, etc.) any specific action items related to that event are entered into PSMWriter, assigned a responsible person, and given a due date. Once the action item has been completed, the resolution can be documented using PSMWriter as well. A list of current or past due action items can be accessed at any time by those with access to PSMWriter.

In addition to utilizing PSMWriter to create, schedule, track, and document events, Sunview Dried Fruit & Nut Company has also entered into a contract with Resource Compliance to obtain help with RMP-PSM program implementation. A copy of Resource Compliance's service agreement has been included in this program with the support material.



For the future, Sunview Dried Fruit & Nut Company now thinks of the RMP-PSM program as a "living document". It is an interactive framework that guides safe action for Sunview Dried Fruit & Nut Company employees, but allows for feedback and continual improvement. Through the RMP-PSM program Sunview Dried Fruit & Nut Company will continue to maintain overall plant worker and public safety.
